# CapturedRoom.Surface

**Structure**

A 2D area in a room that the framework identifies as a surface.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Surface
```

## Overview

A captured room ([doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom]) contains an arrays of surfaces that it identifies in a scan, such as its [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom/doors], [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom/openings], [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom/walls], and [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom/windows].

## Creating a surface

- **init(from:)**: Creates a surface by deserializing the specified decoder.

## Identifying a surface

- **identifier**: A unique alphanumeric value that the framework assigns the surface.
- **parentIdentifier**: A unique alphanumeric value that identifies a surface’s parent surface.
- **category**: A classification that the captured room assigns the surface.
- **CapturedRoom.Surface.Category**: Classifications of a surface in a captured room.
- **confidence**: A level of certainty in the surface’s category.

## Positioning and sizing a surface

- **transform**: A matrix that defines the surface’s position and orientation in the scene.
- **dimensions**: A bounding box that contains the surface.
- **story**: indicator for which story, level, or floor

## Shaping a surface

- **completedEdges**: An array of edges that outline the surface.
- **CapturedRoom.Surface.Edge**: An object that represents a single edge of a surface.
- **curve**: An object that represents the curve of a surface.
- **CapturedRoom.Surface.Curve**: An object that represents a single curve of a surface.
- **polygonCorners**: A 2D polygon that represents nonuniform wall heights and floor shapes.

## Serializing a surface

- **encode(to:)**: Serializes a surface to the specified encoder.

## Inspecting room details

- **identifier**: A unique alphanumeric value that the framework assigns the room.
- **story**: The story, floor number, or level on which the captured room resides within a larger structure.
- **floors**: An array of floors that the framework identifies during a scan.
- **doors**: An array of doors that the framework identifies during a scan.
- **objects**: An array of objects that the framework identifies during a scan.
- **CapturedRoom.Object**: A 3D area in a room that the framework identifies as an object.
- **openings**: An array of openings that the framework identifies during a scan.
- **walls**: An array of walls that the framework identifies during a scan.
- **windows**: An array of windows that the framework identifies during a scan.
- **sections**: One or more room types that the framework observes in the room.
- **CapturedRoom.Section**: An object that identifies a particular area in a captured room in relation to common types of room areas in a building.
- **CapturedRoom.Confidence**: Levels of certainty in the classification of a particular detail in a scan.
- **version**: A version number for the captured room.

## Conforms To

- Decodable
- Encodable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
